title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: Average- a phone call first and then, in person interview in front of a panel of interviewers. During phone call, more general questions and during interview more casual questions of getting to know
Interview Questions: Why do you like teaching?

title: Payroll Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: Moderately long interview, with two pages worth of questions. The questions were often multi part questions. It was a panel interview, with four people interviewing me. They took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: Describe what these forms are, and your experience working with them: W2, 941, W4.

title: Student Conduct Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID)
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared for several committee interviews, a presentation, perhaps a one-on-one with a second or third-level supervisor/final hiring authority, and ultimately a full day gauntlet if you make it past a first interview and get to on campus!
Interview Questions: The questions were not memorable and similar to how your experience fits with the role, what do you know about a specific subject, your approach to restorative justice, etc.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: The people who phone interviewed me were very kind and friendly. Asked great questions that were challenging but not aggressive. They explained the job well and answered all of my questions adequately
Interview Questions: How do you react to a situation involving conflict? Example?

title: Career Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: First round phone interview was about 10 questions and was conducted by a panel, second round on campus with more depth including presentation, q + a, panel interview, and one on one interview with supervisor
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourelf?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Idaho in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interviews across the University of Idaho tend to be very formal. I had close to 10 questions in the initial interview and a few minutes at the end to ask questions of the committee. The first interview was also on Zoom with 5 people, not including myself. The questions seemed very fair and allowed me to give examples of my job-related competencies.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and what motivated you to apply to this position.

title: Facility Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: This is a group interview with 3-5 pro staff and student staff. They alternate asking a list of questions. Pretty straight forward of a process overall. Even though it is a student position, dress nice, it's the little things that make a difference.
Interview Questions: If a patron wanted to come in without their vandal card what would you do?

title: Director of Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a pretty typical state application process: apply online with resume and cover letter followed by a phone screen interview, then an in person. The in person interview was multiple interviews across the same day. My favorite part was meeting engaged students.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have building or maintaining relationships with large companies?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a two step process. First was a phone call and the second was on site. The process was fairly similar to other institutions. I met with a number of faculty, staff, graduate students, and undergraduate students that I would be interacting with in the position.
Interview Questions: Reason for wanting to get a PhD.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview happened through a zoom call from the employer. They asked me questions related to my research and few behavioral and competency-based questions to be comfortable in the group.
Interview Questions:
Tell me what research projects you handled?
What are your research interests and what project would you like to work on?
Would you like to contribute towards teaching and grant writing?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: I had a Skype interview with a panel of professors and a director. Standard questions about teaching practices. I applied online and was contacted via email to set up a Skype interview, Fairly easy process
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Very simple, First step you got admission 
2nd: any of faculty professor who wants to hire you will contact you personally. 
It may be an interview on email, skype or phone call.
Interview Questions: About your research interest and future direction

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: It was a somewhat lengthy application process, but the overall interview experience was fairly pleasant. There were quite a few documents required in order to be interviewed and hired, including a letter of motivation and a background check. Friendly staff and supervisors.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here and how do you handle last minute problems with no superviso around?

title: Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Idaho
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very casual as I anticipated.  Interview committee consisted of two persons.  Personality and experiential questions were asked.  Employer contacted me within a couple of days from the interview date.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to work with a person you didn't get along with? How did you resolve this conflict?

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received phone call to schedule an interview the next day.  Arrived for interview with 3 employees.  Interview questions were to be expected.  2 months later, zero contact.  The job has not been closed, I have not been declined, requests for contact have not been returned.
Interview Questions: Do you support the university or the employees?

title: Assistant Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Idaho in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: 30-minute phone interview with the search committee. Depending on the level of job, an on-site full day interview will follow. Standard interview process and questions. They were kind and welcoming.
Interview Questions: What are my top values?

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was questioned by three members of the facilities department roughly 5 minutes prior to my requested interview time (I had shown up early so this was a pleasant surprise).  They were professional and approachable. They went with another applicant but informed me a few days after the interview that I had not been selected which I greatly appreciated.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Writing Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: After greetings, we talked a little bit about why I wanted to intern and also job details.  I am then given a sample student's paper and had to perform a mock tutoring session on how I would help this student improve his paper.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Idaho in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. The committee was kind and thorough. Mainly they just wanted to know about my research experience. They told me they were interviewing only 3 other candidates. Unfortunately, it took a very long time for them to fill the position. I interviewed the beginning of March and did not hear back until mid-May.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are qualified for this position?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID)
Interview Descriptions: 45 minute telephone interview; then daylong campus visit with teaching and research presentations, and individual 30 minute meetings with individual faculty, and a campus tour; start and end day with the Dean of the college. Pretty typical campus visit process. They are looking for "fit".
Interview Questions: Tell us what interests you about this position and why you think that you would be a good fit?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then in-person Skype for second round. Panel interview with several staff members.  A lot of behavioral questions ("tell me about a time when...") were asked, and they covered the types of things called for in the written job description.  It is helpful to be sure to read the job posting closely and address all of the qualifications in your interview answers.
Interview Questions: Can you give an example of a time your received constructive criticism or feedback?  How did you handle it?

title: Temporary Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was face-to-face interview. it was my first time to face interview in USA. It was some management types questions and related to my fields. I tried to give all answers of the questions which was asking by Interviewer. And in first attempt I got the offer to work in reputed University.
Interview Questions: All questions are related to my fields.

title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel of interviewers sits and asks you questions as a group. They just went through the list of questions and it was informal and comfortable. I think there were 4 or 5 people on the panel.
Interview Questions: What makes you uniquely suited to this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short, sweet and to the point interview. I was quickly hired after the interview. Met with the employer one on one shortly after approaching them about an internship through a different program. While I didn't receive the internship, my employer quickly offered me a job after asking about what lab experience I had.
Interview Questions: What is your laboratory experience?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview on why I wanted the position.  Found the internship by a friend's recommendation and then followed up with the department that was hiring.  After applying the interview process took less then a week.
Interview Questions: What do you look to gain from the internship?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was no real interview I talked with a professor that I was interested working with during my M.S. program and they had funding for a project that interested me so I applied to the College of Graduate Studies. I do believe that my experience was different then most peoples experience in that there are usually more people interested in a particular project.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Sign Language Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Written application processed and interview with the Director of Student services with drug test and background checked after the intital interview and selected for the position and travel pay negotiated.
Interview Questions: Abt my experiences

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and got an interview. I got a call from the dept chair to arrange for the interview. The process was normal for an academic job. The interview went well. I got the job.
Interview Questions: What course would you like to teach? Describe your research

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the hiring professor and received a reply within a week. A phone/skype interview last 1 hour and it was very much a two-way interview. After sounding like a good fit, I was flown to Moscow, Idaho for an in-person interview, which lasted a day. I was given an offer withing a week of my visit.
Interview Questions: Common prospective graduate student questions: Why are you apply for graduate school? What are your career goals? Why do I want to work with the hiring professor?

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Boise, ID) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: easy, simple questions; prepare using basic interview guidelines; discuss the minimum requirements or “basic qualifications” those qualifications or criteria which was established in advance and advertised to potential applicants; main focus was made on preferred qualifications and skills and experience preferred in addition to basic qualifications, that was used to narrow down the pool of applicants. preferred skills, knowledge, abilities and competencies can describe a more proficient level at which the essential functions can be perfomed
Interview Questions:
How do you work under pressure? What is your plan for the next 5 years?
easy, simple questions; prepare using basic interview guidelines; discuss the minimum requirements or “basic qualifications” those qualifications or criteria which was established in advance and advertised to potential applicants; main focus was made on preferred qualifications and skills and experience preferred in addition to basic qualifications, that was used to narrow down the pool of applicants. preferred skills, knowledge, abilities and competencies can describe a more proficient level at which the essential functions can be perfomed

title: Granduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a brief meeting with the future principal investigator. This meeting lasted approximately half an hour. Previous experience as well as the current laboratory projects were discussed. Overall, the objective was to see if I would fit in as a new graduate student.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this particular research?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Idaho (Moscow, ID) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing as a Teaching Assistant was very straight forward.  If you passed the course with a favorable grade and reputation with the staff, you are eligible to become a teaching assistant in a future semester.  The professor and department submitted all necessary paperwork leaving you to focus on your responsibilities in the classroom.
Interview Questions: As mentioned above, My grade and professor relationship in the course was my only step to gaining the position.  I didn't have to answer questions.
